p.s: The excerpt is important for the whole movie because it represents the relationship of Starr and Chris.
We get to see the dynamics of the couple and how they work together.
In the first part of the sequence we see Chris out of Starr's perspective.
He's popular friends with everyone and it seems like Starr feels a bit small and insignificant next to her boyfriend.
On his way to her he's shown in a medium shot.
The camera is on the same level as his eyes.
Chris is represented as the most important person in the hallway.
This is underlined by the song Ocean Eyes by Billie Eilish playing in the background.
It's about a person watching and missing someone.
It is interesting to notice how there's a voice-over of Starr who comments on the situation.
This makes the whole sequence seem like a diary entry.
She's describing her boyfriend, her anger and the relationship.
We see that she's in love with boyfriend and notices small details like him wearing the same Jordans like hers.
Chris is also in love with Starr.
It seems like he's enjoying fighting for her to forgive him.
He does a lot of things to show her his love and affection.
But, she also talks about wanting more intimacy.
Chris wants to meet Starr's parents and accuses her of avoiding it.
After Starr forgives him they both walk out of the camera frame.
In the next shot we see them in a close up that underlines the intimacy and tension.
Their faces are very near to each other like they're going to kiss in the next shot.
Chrisseemesseemsreleavedrelieved and excited.
However, he's presented very confident as we can see in a shot where he walks along the hallway towards the camera.
It is interesting to see how Chris is kind of two-faced.
When talking to his friends he appears confident and funny.
Starr can see through the perfect wall thothough.
She sees him the way he is.
With Starr, Chris can be emotional and vulnerable.
This is underlined with medium and long shots being used for Chris around his friends and (medium) close ups being used for Chris around Starr.
It is important to notice how the background music has an effect on the atmosphere.
They're in a fight and missing each other, so we listen to a sad song.
Later Chris tries to make Starr happy and cheer her up by showing her a dynamic, relaxing beat.
There's a huge difference between these two songs.
They always represent the atmosphere and how Starr and Chris are feeling.
Just like the songs, it seems like the two teenager complement each other.
Chris is presented as a caring boyfriend who cheers her up but also has his own sadness and emotions which he shows her.
Sometimes he's torn between being the popular guy and Starr's boyfriend at the same time which can lead to him hurting people by accident.
